results.title: Lifestyle intervention is associated with lower prevalence of urinary incontinence: the Diabetes Prevention Program.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: The prevalence of total (stress or urge) weekly @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Incontinence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014549 @@@incontinence@@@ was lower among @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ in the intensive lifestyle group (38.3%) than those randomized to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (48.1%) or placebo (45.7%).

citations.NLM: Brown JS, Wing R, Barrett-Connor E, Nyberg LM, Kusek JW, Orchard TJ, Ma Y, Vittinghoff E, Kanaya AM, Diabetes Prevention Program Research Group. Lifestyle intervention is associated with lower prevalence of urinary incontinence: the Diabetes Prevention Program. Diabetes Care. 2006 Feb;29(2):385-90. PMID: 16443892
citations.BibTeX: @article{16443892, title={Lifestyle intervention is associated with lower prevalence of urinary incontinence: the Diabetes Prevention Program.}, author={Brown JS and Wing R and Barrett-Connor E and Nyberg LM and Kusek JW and Orchard TJ and Ma Y and Vittinghoff E and Kanaya AM and Diabetes Prevention Program Research Group}, journal={Diabetes Care}, volume={29}, number={2}, pages={385-90}}

results.title: Diarrhea and metformin in a diabetic clinic.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ is by far the commonest cause of @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Incontinence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014549 @@@incontinence@@@ in our @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ clinic, where it is used routinely.

citations.NLM: Dandona P, Fonseca V, Mier A, Beckett AG. Diarrhea and metformin in a diabetic clinic. Diabetes Care. 1983 Sep-Oct;6(5):472-4. PMID: 6336343
citations.BibTeX: @article{6336343, title={Diarrhea and metformin in a diabetic clinic.}, author={Dandona P and Fonseca V and Mier A and Beckett AG}, journal={Diabetes Care}, volume={6}, number={5}, pages={472-4}}

results.title: Metformin as a cause of late-onset chronic diarrhea.
results.text_hl: Our @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ began to experience @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @DISEASE_Colic @DISEASE_MESH:D003085 @@@abdominal cramping@@@, and explosive watery @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@ that occasionally caused @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Incontinence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014549 @@@incontinence@@@ after several years of stable @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy A trial of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ discontinuation resolved all @DISEASE_Signs_and_Symptoms_Digestive @DISEASE_MESH:D012817 @@@gastrointestinal symptoms@@@.

citations.NLM: Foss MT, Clement KD. Metformin as a cause of late-onset chronic diarrhea. Pharmacotherapy. 2001 Nov;21(11):1422-4. PMID: 11714216
citations.BibTeX: @article{11714216, title={Metformin as a cause of late-onset chronic diarrhea.}, author={Foss MT and Clement KD}, journal={Pharmacotherapy}, volume={21}, number={11}, pages={1422-4}}

results.title: Long-term prevalence and predictors of urinary incontinence among women in the Diabetes Prevention Program Outcomes Study.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: At the study entry, the prevalence of weekly @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Incontinence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014549 @@@urinary incontinence@@@ was lower in the intensive lifestyle intervention group compared with the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and placebo groups (44.2% vs 51.8%, 48.0% @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Incontinence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014549 @@@urinary incontinence@@@/week, P = 0.04); during the 6-year follow-up period, these lower rates in intensive lifestyle intervention were maintained (46.7%, 53.1%, 49.9% @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Incontinence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014549 @@@urinary incontinence@@@/week; P = 0.03).

citations.NLM: Phelan S, Kanaya AM, Ma Y, Vittinghoff E, Barrett-Connor E, Wing R, Kusek JW, Orchard TJ, Crandall JP, Montez MG, Brown JS, Diabetes Prevention Program Research Group. Long-term prevalence and predictors of urinary incontinence among women in the Diabetes Prevention Program Outcomes Study. Int J Urol. 2015 Feb;22(2):206-12. PMID: 25352018
citations.BibTeX: @article{25352018, title={Long-term prevalence and predictors of urinary incontinence among women in the Diabetes Prevention Program Outcomes Study.}, author={Phelan S and Kanaya AM and Ma Y and Vittinghoff E and Barrett-Connor E and Wing R and Kusek JW and Orchard TJ and Crandall JP and Montez MG and Brown JS and Diabetes Prevention Program Research Group}, journal={Int J Urol}, volume={22}, number={2}, pages={206-12}}

results.title: Oral hypoglycaemic drugs and gastrointestinal symptoms in diabetes mellitus.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: 405 of the 956 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ used oral hypoglycaemic drugs. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ use was independently associated with chronic @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ (odds ratio 3.08, 95% CI: 1.29-7.36, P < 0.02) and with @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Incontinence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014549 @@@faecal incontinence@@@ (odds ratio 1.95, 95% CI: 1.10-3.47, P < 0.05).

citations.NLM: Bytzer P, Talley NJ, Jones MP, Horowitz M. Oral hypoglycaemic drugs and gastrointestinal symptoms in diabetes mellitus. Aliment Pharmacol Ther. 2001 Jan;15(1):137-42. PMID: 11136287
citations.BibTeX: @article{11136287, title={Oral hypoglycaemic drugs and gastrointestinal symptoms in diabetes mellitus.}, author={Bytzer P and Talley NJ and Jones MP and Horowitz M}, journal={Aliment Pharmacol Ther}, volume={15}, number={1}, pages={137-42}}
